p: An improved understanding of the complex dynamic of factors involved in dengue transmission requires the characterization of different parameters related to the incidence of asymptomatic, sub-clinical and symptomatic infections [ 8, 9]; the prevalence and seroconversion rates by age group and sex; the herd immunity to specific serotypes [ 10]; the profile of primary and secondary infections and risk factors associated with severe dengue; as well as their relationship with the entomological variables at the individual, household, neighborhood, locality and regional levels [ 11â€“ 14].
